        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        The <span class="line"><!---->The <!----></span>Issue 1160665<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1160665" title="Requests for script sent even when main document is text/plain"><!---->Issue 1160665<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>was tested on Android. I tried to open console of Android in browser and was able to see request of script tags being sent. <span class="line"><!---->was tested on Android. I tried to open console of Android in browser and was able to see request of script tags being sent. <!----></span><br>Screenshot should be referred: 1 & 2<span class="line"><!---->Screenshot should be referred: 1 &amp; 2<!----></span><br><br>In the desktop browser, it is working as intended. Also, no idea due to which reason, when I run Chrome Browser Android, I wasn't able to use its JS Console in the Chrome Browser with USB but the Yandex is able to capture all of its data, why? Is it allowed that other Chromium based browsers are allowed to do this for Chrome?<span class="line"><!---->In the desktop browser, it is working as intended. Also, no idea due to which reason, when I run Chrome Browser Android, I wasn't able to use its JS Console in the Chrome Browser with USB but the Yandex is able to capture all of its data, why? Is it allowed that other Chromium based browsers are allowed to do this for Chrome?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Isn't this issue similar to "Content-Sniffing"? If yes, it should not be performed by modern browsers. It can be exploited on sites that e.g. allow uploading and viewing plain-text files. As the browser would then see that it contains HTML, and thus render it (including the embedded JavaScript code). If yes, it will be more or less UXSS, yes?<span class="line"><!---->Isn't this issue similar to "Content-Sniffing"? If yes, it should not be performed by modern browsers. It can be exploited on sites that e.g. allow uploading and viewing plain-text files. As the browser would then see that it contains HTML, and thus render it (including the embedded JavaScript code). If yes, it will be more or less UXSS, yes?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        OK, that's not quite the behaviour I see on the desktop version (I always see the request). Here's what I'm doing:<span class="line"><!---->OK, that's not quite the behaviour I see on the desktop version (I always see the request). Here's what I'm doing:<!----></span><br><br>1. Open a fresh browser<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a fresh browser<!----></span><br>2. Right click > Open Developer Tools > Network (red for record)<span class="line"><!---->2. Right click &gt; Open Developer Tools &gt; Network (red for record)<!----></span><br>3. Type 'data:text/plain, <script src="//cm2.pw"> </script>' in the address bar, press enter<span class="line"><!---->3. Type 'data:text/plain, &lt;script src="//cm2.pw"&gt; &lt;/script&gt;' in the address bar, press enter<!----></span><br>4. See data:text/plain, <script> request in network requests<span class="line"><!---->4. See data:text/plain, &lt;script&gt; request in network requests<!----></span><br><br>Unfortunately I don't have m90 available right now, here's two screenshots from 89.0.4389.90 (Official Build) (64-bit) (89.png) and 92.0.4511.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit) (m92). So studying your video and attempting to replicate your process:<span class="line"><!---->Unfortunately I don't have m90 available right now, here's two screenshots from 89.0.4389.90 (Official Build) (64-bit) (89.png) and 92.0.4511.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit) (m92). So studying your video and attempting to replicate your process:<!----></span><br><br>1. Open a fresh browser<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a fresh browser<!----></span><br>2. Navigate to 'data:text/plain, <script src="//cm2.pw"> </script>' <span class="line"><!---->2. Navigate to 'data:text/plain, &lt;script src="//cm2.pw"&gt; &lt;/script&gt;' <!----></span><br>3. Open developer tools<span class="line"><!---->3. Open developer tools<!----></span><br><br>I _don't see_ the request. I think the reason for this is because network tracing has some performance and so is disabled when you don't have the development tools open. Could you try refreshing the data:text/plain page with the developer tools open and let me know what happens?<span class="line"><!---->I _don't see_ the request. I think the reason for this is because network tracing has some performance and so is disabled when you don't have the development tools open. Could you try refreshing the data:text/plain page with the developer tools open and let me know what happens?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        It could be that the device tracing is done via a plugin, restoring your command line flags might get the USB devtools working again. <span class="line"><!---->It could be that the device tracing is done via a plugin, restoring your command line flags might get the USB devtools working again. <!----></span><br><br>Stepping back for a sec, it does look like all the requests are accounted for on this one: we've got a under-the-hood request out to fulfil the 'data:text/plain, <script src="//cm2.pw"> </script>' navigation, but no network activity. For a fingerprinting attack like the one previously fixed, I'd expect to see one or more secondary requests over the network (e.g. to prefetch the script src), but that doesn't seem to be happening here AFAICT. Is there anything else we should look at for this one?<span class="line"><!---->Stepping back for a sec, it does look like all the requests are accounted for on this one: we've got a under-the-hood request out to fulfil the 'data:text/plain, &lt;script src="//cm2.pw"&gt; &lt;/script&gt;' navigation, but no network activity. For a fingerprinting attack like the one previously fixed, I'd expect to see one or more secondary requests over the network (e.g. to prefetch the script src), but that doesn't seem to be happening here AFAICT. Is there anything else we should look at for this one?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello,<span class="line"><!---->Hello,<!----></span><br>> It could be that the device tracing is done via a plugin, restoring your command line flags might get the USB devtools working again. <span class="line"><!---->&gt; It could be that the device tracing is done via a plugin, restoring your command line flags might get the USB devtools working again. <!----></span><br>I tried to re-install the Chrome Stable. I was still facing HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found. <span class="line"><!---->I tried to re-install the Chrome Stable. I was still facing HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found. <!----></span><br><br>> Stepping back for a sec, it does look like all the requests are accounted for on this one: we've got a under-the-hood request out to fulfil the 'data:text/plain, <script src="//cm2.pw"> </script>' navigation, but no network activity. For a fingerprinting attack like the one previously fixed, I'd expect to see one or more secondary requests over the network (e.g. to prefetch the script src), but that doesn't seem to be happening here AFAICT. Is there anything else we should look at for this one?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Stepping back for a sec, it does look like all the requests are accounted for on this one: we've got a under-the-hood request out to fulfil the 'data:text/plain, &lt;script src="//cm2.pw"&gt; &lt;/script&gt;' navigation, but no network activity. For a fingerprinting attack like the one previously fixed, I'd expect to see one or more secondary requests over the network (e.g. to prefetch the script src), but that doesn't seem to be happening here AFAICT. Is there anything else we should look at for this one?<!----></span><br><br>Exactly. It is working as intended. But a question which arises here is: When you connect USB with computer, Chrome stable user data is being tracked in the Yandex browser. I am not sure why did it allow. Is it intended? Because if any other application is able to pull it, it will also be able to get the session tokens etc., yes? Can't we limit it to Chrome browser only?<span class="line"><!---->Exactly. It is working as intended. But a question which arises here is: When you connect USB with computer, Chrome stable user data is being tracked in the Yandex browser. I am not sure why did it allow. Is it intended? Because if any other application is able to pull it, it will also be able to get the session tokens etc., yes? Can't we limit it to Chrome browser only?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;

          border-collapse: collapse;

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }

          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;

        for LitElement.

            close<i class="material-icons">close</i>

            <i class="material-icons">close</i>
          </button>

          <span>Blocked on issues</span>

          </button>

          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;

          }

            min-height: 0;

          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          
        <div class="keyboard-help">
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up/down in the list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->o<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Shift-O<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->open issue in new tab<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->x<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->select the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Issue details<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->k<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->j<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->prev/next issue in list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->u<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->up to issue list<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->r<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->reply to current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->Ctrl+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator"> / </span>
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->⌘+Enter<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->save issue reply (submit issue on issue filing page)<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
            <div class="keyboard-help-section">
              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>

              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->

                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

        The <span class="line"><!---->The <!----></span>Issue 1160665<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1160665" title="Requests for script sent even when main document is text/plain"><!---->Issue 1160665<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>was tested on Android. I tried to open console of Android in browser and was able to see request of script tags being sent. <span class="line"><!---->was tested on Android. I tried to open console of Android in browser and was able to see request of script tags being sent. <!----></span><br>Screenshot should be referred: 1 & 2<span class="line"><!---->Screenshot should be referred: 1 &amp; 2<!----></span><br><br>In the desktop browser, it is working as intended. Also, no idea due to which reason, when I run Chrome Browser Android, I wasn't able to use its JS Console in the Chrome Browser with USB but the Yandex is able to capture all of its data, why? Is it allowed that other Chromium based browsers are allowed to do this for Chrome?<span class="line"><!---->In the desktop browser, it is working as intended. Also, no idea due to which reason, when I run Chrome Browser Android, I wasn't able to use its JS Console in the Chrome Browser with USB but the Yandex is able to capture all of its data, why? Is it allowed that other Chromium based browsers are allowed to do this for Chrome?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Isn't this issue similar to "Content-Sniffing"? If yes, it should not be performed by modern browsers. It can be exploited on sites that e.g. allow uploading and viewing plain-text files. As the browser would then see that it contains HTML, and thus render it (including the embedded JavaScript code). If yes, it will be more or less UXSS, yes?<span class="line"><!---->Isn't this issue similar to "Content-Sniffing"? If yes, it should not be performed by modern browsers. It can be exploited on sites that e.g. allow uploading and viewing plain-text files. As the browser would then see that it contains HTML, and thus render it (including the embedded JavaScript code). If yes, it will be more or less UXSS, yes?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        OK, that's not quite the behaviour I see on the desktop version (I always see the request). Here's what I'm doing:<span class="line"><!---->OK, that's not quite the behaviour I see on the desktop version (I always see the request). Here's what I'm doing:<!----></span><br><br>1. Open a fresh browser<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a fresh browser<!----></span><br>2. Right click > Open Developer Tools > Network (red for record)<span class="line"><!---->2. Right click &gt; Open Developer Tools &gt; Network (red for record)<!----></span><br>3. Type 'data:text/plain, <script src="//cm2.pw"> </script>' in the address bar, press enter<span class="line"><!---->3. Type 'data:text/plain, &lt;script src="//cm2.pw"&gt; &lt;/script&gt;' in the address bar, press enter<!----></span><br>4. See data:text/plain, <script> request in network requests<span class="line"><!---->4. See data:text/plain, &lt;script&gt; request in network requests<!----></span><br><br>Unfortunately I don't have m90 available right now, here's two screenshots from 89.0.4389.90 (Official Build) (64-bit) (89.png) and 92.0.4511.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit) (m92). So studying your video and attempting to replicate your process:<span class="line"><!---->Unfortunately I don't have m90 available right now, here's two screenshots from 89.0.4389.90 (Official Build) (64-bit) (89.png) and 92.0.4511.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit) (m92). So studying your video and attempting to replicate your process:<!----></span><br><br>1. Open a fresh browser<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a fresh browser<!----></span><br>2. Navigate to 'data:text/plain, <script src="//cm2.pw"> </script>' <span class="line"><!---->2. Navigate to 'data:text/plain, &lt;script src="//cm2.pw"&gt; &lt;/script&gt;' <!----></span><br>3. Open developer tools<span class="line"><!---->3. Open developer tools<!----></span><br><br>I _don't see_ the request. I think the reason for this is because network tracing has some performance and so is disabled when you don't have the development tools open. Could you try refreshing the data:text/plain page with the developer tools open and let me know what happens?<span class="line"><!---->I _don't see_ the request. I think the reason for this is because network tracing has some performance and so is disabled when you don't have the development tools open. Could you try refreshing the data:text/plain page with the developer tools open and let me know what happens?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        It could be that the device tracing is done via a plugin, restoring your command line flags might get the USB devtools working again. <span class="line"><!---->It could be that the device tracing is done via a plugin, restoring your command line flags might get the USB devtools working again. <!----></span><br><br>Stepping back for a sec, it does look like all the requests are accounted for on this one: we've got a under-the-hood request out to fulfil the 'data:text/plain, <script src="//cm2.pw"> </script>' navigation, but no network activity. For a fingerprinting attack like the one previously fixed, I'd expect to see one or more secondary requests over the network (e.g. to prefetch the script src), but that doesn't seem to be happening here AFAICT. Is there anything else we should look at for this one?<span class="line"><!---->Stepping back for a sec, it does look like all the requests are accounted for on this one: we've got a under-the-hood request out to fulfil the 'data:text/plain, &lt;script src="//cm2.pw"&gt; &lt;/script&gt;' navigation, but no network activity. For a fingerprinting attack like the one previously fixed, I'd expect to see one or more secondary requests over the network (e.g. to prefetch the script src), but that doesn't seem to be happening here AFAICT. Is there anything else we should look at for this one?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

But a question which arises here is: When you connect USB with computer, Chrome stable user data is being tracked in the Yandex browser. I am not sure why did it allow. Is it intended? Because if any other application is able to pull it, it will also be able to get the session tokens etc., yes? Can't we limit it to Chrome browser only?<span class="line"><!---->Exactly. It is working as intended. But a question which arises here is: When you connect USB with computer, Chrome stable user data is being tracked in the Yandex browser. I am not sure why did it allow. Is it intended? Because if any other application is able to pull it, it will also be able to get the session tokens etc., yes?               <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM

          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          <div class="input-grid">

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;

        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>

        The <span class="line"><!---->The <!----></span>Issue 1160665<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1160665" title="Requests for script sent even when main document is text/plain"><!---->Issue 1160665<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>was tested on Android. I tried to open console of Android in browser and was able to see request of script tags being sent. <span class="line"><!---->was tested on Android. I tried to open console of Android in browser and was able to see request of script tags being sent. <!----></span><br>Screenshot should be referred: 1 & 2<span class="line"><!---->Screenshot should be referred: 1 &amp; 2<!----></span><br><br>In the desktop browser, it is working as intended. Also, no idea due to which reason, when I run Chrome Browser Android, I wasn't able to use its JS Console in the Chrome Browser with USB but the Yandex is able to capture all of its data, why? Is it allowed that other Chromium based browsers are allowed to do this for Chrome?<span class="line"><!---->In the desktop browser, it is working as intended. Also, no idea due to which reason, when I run Chrome Browser Android, I wasn't able to use its JS Console in the Chrome Browser with USB but the Yandex is able to capture all of its data, why?         Isn't this issue similar to "Content-Sniffing"? If yes, it should not be performed by modern browsers. It can be exploited on sites that e.g. allow uploading and viewing plain-text files. As the browser would then see that it contains HTML, and thus render it (including the embedded JavaScript code). If yes, it will be more or less UXSS, yes?<span class="line"><!---->Isn't this issue similar to "Content-Sniffing"? If yes, it should not be performed by modern browsers. It can be exploited on sites that e.g. allow uploading and viewing plain-text files. As the browser would then see that it contains HTML, and thus render it (including the embedded JavaScript code). If yes, it will be more or less UXSS, yes?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        OK, that's not quite the behaviour I see on the desktop version (I always see the request). Here's what I'm doing:<span class="line"><!---->OK, that's not quite the behaviour I see on the desktop version (I always see the request). Here's what I'm doing:<!----></span><br><br>1. Open a fresh browser<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a fresh browser<!----></span><br>2. Right click > Open Developer Tools > Network (red for record)<span class="line"><!---->2. Right click &gt; Open Developer Tools &gt; Network (red for record)<!----></span><br>3. Type 'data:text/plain, <script src="//cm2.pw"> </script>' in the address bar, press enter<span class="line"><!---->3. Type 'data:text/plain, &lt;script src="//cm2.pw"&gt; &lt;/script&gt;' in the address bar, press enter<!----></span><br>4. See data:text/plain, <script> request in network requests<span class="line"><!---->4. See data:text/plain, &lt;script&gt; request in network requests<!----></span><br><br>Unfortunately I don't have m90 available right now, here's two screenshots from 89.0.4389.90 (Official Build) (64-bit) (89.png) and 92.0.4511.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit) (m92). So studying your video and attempting to replicate your process:<span class="line"><!---->Unfortunately I don't have m90 available right now, here's two screenshots from 89.0.4389.90 (Official Build) (64-bit) (89.png) and 92.0.4511.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit) (m92). So studying your video and attempting to replicate your process:<!----></span><br><br>1. Open a fresh browser<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a fresh browser<!----></span><br>2. Navigate to 'data:text/plain, <script src="//cm2.pw"> </script>' <span class="line"><!---->2. Navigate to 'data:text/plain, &lt;script src="//cm2.pw"&gt; &lt;/script&gt;' <!----></span><br>3. Open developer tools<span class="line"><!---->3. Open developer tools<!----></span><br><br>I _don't see_ the request. I think the reason for this is because network tracing has some performance and so is disabled when you don't have the development tools open. Could you try refreshing the data:text/plain page with the developer tools open and let me know what happens?<span class="line"><!---->I _don't see_ the request. I think the reason for this is because network tracing has some performance and so is disabled when you don't have the development tools open. Could you try refreshing the data:text/plain page with the developer tools open and let me know what happens?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        It could be that the device tracing is done via a plugin, restoring your command line flags might get the USB devtools working again. <span class="line"><!---->It could be that the device tracing is done via a plugin, restoring your command line flags might get the USB devtools working again. <!----></span><br><br>Stepping back for a sec, it does look like all the requests are accounted for on this one: we've got a under-the-hood request out to fulfil the 'data:text/plain, <script src="//cm2.pw"> </script>' navigation, but no network activity. For a fingerprinting attack like the one previously fixed, I'd expect to see one or more secondary requests over the network (e.g. to prefetch the script src), but that doesn't seem to be happening here AFAICT. Is there anything else we should look at for this one?<span class="line"><!---->Stepping back for a sec, it does look like all the requests are accounted for on this one: we've got a under-the-hood request out to fulfil the 'data:text/plain, &lt;script src="//cm2.pw"&gt; &lt;/script&gt;' navigation, but no network activity. For a fingerprinting attack like the one previously fixed, I'd expect to see one or more secondary requests over the network (e.g. to prefetch the script src), but that doesn't seem to be happening here AFAICT. Is there anything else we should look at for this one?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        Hello,<span class="line"><!---->Hello,<!----></span><br>> It could be that the device tracing is done via a plugin, restoring your command line flags might get the USB devtools working again. <span class="line"><!---->&gt; It could be that the device tracing is done via a plugin, restoring your command line flags might get the USB devtools working again. <!----></span><br>I tried to re-install the Chrome Stable. I was still facing HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found. <span class="line"><!---->I tried to re-install the Chrome Stable. I was still facing HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found. <!----></span><br><br>> Stepping back for a sec, it does look like all the requests are accounted for on this one: we've got a under-the-hood request out to fulfil the 'data:text/plain, <script src="//cm2.pw"> </script>' navigation, but no network activity. For a fingerprinting attack like the one previously fixed, I'd expect to see one or more secondary requests over the network (e.g. to prefetch the script src), but that doesn't seem to be happening here AFAICT. Is there anything else we should look at for this one?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Stepping back for a sec, it does look like all the requests are accounted for on this one: we've got a under-the-hood request out to fulfil the 'data:text/plain, &lt;script src="//cm2.pw"&gt; &lt;/script&gt;' navigation, but no network activity. For a fingerprinting attack like the one previously fixed, I'd expect to see one or more secondary requests over the network (e.g. to prefetch the script src), but that doesn't seem to be happening here AFAICT. Is there anything else we should look at for this one?<!----></span><br><br>Exactly. It is working as intended. But a question which arises here is: When you connect USB with computer, Chrome stable user data is being tracked in the Yandex browser. I am not sure why did it allow. Is it intended? Because if any other application is able to pull it, it will also be able to get the session tokens etc., yes? Can't we limit it to Chrome browser only?<span class="line"><!---->Exactly. It is working as intended. But a question which arises here is: When you connect USB with computer, Chrome stable user data is being tracked in the Yandex browser. I am not sure why did it allow. Is it intended? Because if any other application is able to pull it, it will also be able to get the session tokens etc., yes? Can't we limit it to Chrome browser only?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      
        
          
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        
          
            
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        The <span class="line"><!---->The <!----></span>Issue 1160665<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1160665" title="Requests for script sent even when main document is text/plain"><!---->Issue 1160665<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>was tested on Android. I tried to open console of Android in browser and was able to see request of script tags being sent. <span class="line"><!---->was tested on Android. I tried to open console of Android in browser and was able to see request of script tags being sent. <!----></span><br>Screenshot should be referred: 1 & 2<span class="line"><!---->Screenshot should be referred: 1 &amp; 2<!----></span><br><br>In the desktop browser, it is working as intended. Also, no idea due to which reason, when I run Chrome Browser Android, I wasn't able to use its JS Console in the Chrome Browser with USB but the Yandex is able to capture all of its data, why? Is it allowed that other Chromium based browsers are allowed to do this for Chrome?<span class="line"><!---->In the desktop browser, it is working as intended. Also, no idea due to which reason, when I run Chrome Browser Android, I wasn't able to use its JS Console in the Chrome Browser with USB but the Yandex is able to capture all of its data, why? Is it allowed that other Chromium based browsers are allowed to do this for Chrome?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Isn't this issue similar to "Content-Sniffing"? If yes, it should not be performed by modern browsers. It can be exploited on sites that e.g. allow uploading and viewing plain-text files. As the browser would then see that it contains HTML, and thus render it (including the embedded JavaScript code). If yes, it will be more or less UXSS, yes?<span class="line"><!---->Isn't this issue similar to "Content-Sniffing"? If yes, it should not be performed by modern browsers. It can be exploited on sites that e.g. allow uploading and viewing plain-text files. As the browser would then see that it contains HTML, and thus render it (including the embedded JavaScript code). If yes, it will be more or less UXSS, yes?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        OK, that's not quite the behaviour I see on the desktop version (I always see the request). Here's what I'm doing:<span class="line"><!---->OK, that's not quite the behaviour I see on the desktop version (I always see the request). Here's what I'm doing:<!----></span><br><br>1. Open a fresh browser<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a fresh browser<!----></span><br>2. Right click > Open Developer Tools > Network (red for record)<span class="line"><!---->2. Right click &gt; Open Developer Tools &gt; Network (red for record)<!----></span><br>3. Type 'data:text/plain, <script src="//cm2.pw"> </script>' in the address bar, press enter<span class="line"><!---->3. Type 'data:text/plain, &lt;script src="//cm2.pw"&gt; &lt;/script&gt;' in the address bar, press enter<!----></span><br>4. See data:text/plain, <script> request in network requests<span class="line"><!---->4. See data:text/plain, &lt;script&gt; request in network requests<!----></span><br><br>Unfortunately I don't have m90 available right now, here's two screenshots from 89.0.4389.90 (Official Build) (64-bit) (89.png) and 92.0.4511.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit) (m92). So studying your video and attempting to replicate your process:<span class="line"><!---->Unfortunately I don't have m90 available right now, here's two screenshots from 89.0.4389.90 (Official Build) (64-bit) (89.png) and 92.0.4511.0 (Developer Build) (64-bit) (m92). So studying your video and attempting to replicate your process:<!----></span><br><br>1. Open a fresh browser<span class="line"><!---->1. Open a fresh browser<!----></span><br>2. Navigate to 'data:text/plain, <script src="//cm2.pw"> </script>' <span class="line"><!---->2. Navigate to 'data:text/plain, &lt;script src="//cm2.pw"&gt; &lt;/script&gt;' <!----></span><br>3. Open developer tools<span class="line"><!---->3. Open developer tools<!----></span><br><br>I _don't see_ the request. I think the reason for this is because network tracing has some performance and so is disabled when you don't have the development tools open. Could you try refreshing the data:text/plain page with the developer tools open and let me know what happens?<span class="line"><!---->I _don't see_ the request. I think the reason for this is because network tracing has some performance and so is disabled when you don't have the development tools open. Could you try refreshing the data:text/plain page with the developer tools open and let me know what happens?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        It could be that the device tracing is done via a plugin, restoring your command line flags might get the USB devtools working again. <span class="line"><!---->It could be that the device tracing is done via a plugin, restoring your command line flags might get the USB devtools working again. <!----></span><br><br>Stepping back for a sec, it does look like all the requests are accounted for on this one: we've got a under-the-hood request out to fulfil the 'data:text/plain, <script src="//cm2.pw"> </script>' navigation, but no network activity. For a fingerprinting attack like the one previously fixed, I'd expect to see one or more secondary requests over the network (e.g. to prefetch the script src), but that doesn't seem to be happening here AFAICT. Is there anything else we should look at for this one?<span class="line"><!---->Stepping back for a sec, it does look like all the requests are accounted for on this one: we've got a under-the-hood request out to fulfil the 'data:text/plain, &lt;script src="//cm2.pw"&gt; &lt;/script&gt;' navigation, but no network activity. For a fingerprinting attack like the one previously fixed, I'd expect to see one or more secondary requests over the network (e.g. to prefetch the script src), but that doesn't seem to be happening here AFAICT. Is there anything else we should look at for this one?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Hello,<span class="line"><!---->Hello,<!----></span><br>> It could be that the device tracing is done via a plugin, restoring your command line flags might get the USB devtools working again. <span class="line"><!---->&gt; It could be that the device tracing is done via a plugin, restoring your command line flags might get the USB devtools working again. <!----></span><br>I tried to re-install the Chrome Stable. I was still facing HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found. <span class="line"><!---->I tried to re-install the Chrome Stable. I was still facing HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found. <!----></span><br><br>> Stepping back for a sec, it does look like all the requests are accounted for on this one: we've got a under-the-hood request out to fulfil the 'data:text/plain, <script src="//cm2.pw"> </script>' navigation, but no network activity. For a fingerprinting attack like the one previously fixed, I'd expect to see one or more secondary requests over the network (e.g. to prefetch the script src), but that doesn't seem to be happening here AFAICT. Is there anything else we should look at for this one?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Stepping back for a sec, it does look like all the requests are accounted for on this one: we've got a under-the-hood request out to fulfil the 'data:text/plain, &lt;script src="//cm2.pw"&gt; &lt;/script&gt;' navigation, but no network activity. For a fingerprinting attack like the one previously fixed, I'd expect to see one or more secondary requests over the network (e.g. to prefetch the script src), but that doesn't seem to be happening here AFAICT. Is there anything else we should look at for this one?<!----></span><br><br>Exactly. It is working as intended. But a question which arises here is: When you connect USB with computer, Chrome stable user data is being tracked in the Yandex browser. I am not sure why did it allow. Is it intended? Because if any other application is able to pull it, it will also be able to get the session tokens etc., yes? Can't we limit it to Chrome browser only?<span class="line"><!---->Exactly. It is working as intended. But a question which arises here is: When you connect USB with computer, Chrome stable user data is being tracked in the Yandex browser. I am not sure why did it allow. Is it intended? Because if any other application is able to pull it, it will also be able to get the session tokens etc., yes? Can't we limit it to Chrome browser only?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

            Issue 1212472: Security: Requests for script tags are being sent even though content-type of page is text/plain
          <h1>
